text:
A Glimpse On Fascinating Singapore Travel Packages A Glimpse On Fascinating Singapore Travel Packages 0 
One of the prime tourist destinations of Asia, Singapore is regarded among the cleanest and safest cities in the world. This city country is a shoppers' paradise with ample shopping deals ranging from small stores to luxurious merchandise outlets. It also houses a large number of shops offering cool electronic gadgets that are equipped with the latest technology. Further, there are numerous restaurants, food courts, cafes as well as hawker food stalls available all around the city, so that no traveler ever has surged cravings for eatables in this food-crazy country. 
Apart from shopping facilities, Singapore also boasts of modern theme parks, museums and some of the most excellent examples of colonial architecture. Moreover, the country's outstanding transportation system makes it easy for travelers to get around the island. 
1. Universal Studios Singapore 
Officially opened in 2011, Universal Studios Singapore is a fun theme park with some of the most amazing rides, including the world's tallest roller coasters. Here, visitors can also enjoy movies, live shows and other entertainment immersing themselves in the world of fantasy. Additionally, the park is divided into seven theme zones, with each zone having its own set of attractions. 
2. Marina Bay Sands 
Standing tall at the Marina Bay waterfront with its three monstrous towers, Marina Bay Sands is one of the most popular buildings of Singapore. This hotel has 57 floors with a vanishing edge on Skydeck and encompasses a lot of attractions like casino, shopping mall, resorts, theatres, swimming pool and an ice skating rink. 
3. Gardens by the Bay 
An exemplary combination of modern architecture and exotic plant life, Gardens by the Bay is home to different species of tropical plants and giant tree-like structures known as Supertrees. Travelers can roam along an elevated walkway between the Supertrees. 
4. Sentosa Island 
Sentosa Island is among the Singapore's must-see attractions and houses a variety of activities, including kayaking, beach volleyball and wave riding. A few other attractions on this island are oceanarium, Underwater World Singapore which is home to more than 2500 marine lives. 
5. Orchard Road 
A 2.2-km street, Orchard Road is a glittering street with wide sidewalks and numerous benches to rest your tired feet. Home to dozens of malls selling everything from houseware to high fashion to advanced electronics, this road also comprises of some of the city's most luxurious and expensive hotels. 
6. Singapore F1 Grand Prix 
Travelers never forget to add this international Grand Prix event in their Singapore packages from Delhi. One of the most spectacular happenings of the country, this event is a treat for people having a passion for speed. 
7. Merlion Park 
Your Singapore holiday packages from Delhi won't be termed as full-fledged without a visit to Merlion Park. An excellent landmark of the country, this is an iconic creature with the head of a lion and body of a mermaid. 
8. S.E.A. Aquarium 
Encompasses 800 unique acquatic species, S.E.A. aquarium is the largest oceanarium in the world. Stretched over a large area, the underwater glass tunnel covered by many spectacular water creatures gives a feel of a real deep-ocean diver. 
9. Singapore Zoo 
Spread over an area of 28-hectares, Singapore Zoo has around 315 animal species living in their natural habitat. Unlike other zoo sites of the world, it omiys heavy steel bars as well as aggravated animals, in order to give its visitors wildlife experience from up close. 
10. Chinatown 
Singapore packages from Delhi also involve a walkway to Chinatown that showcases Singapore's Chinese culture and its multicultural history. This place is brightly enlighted and lively offering delicious cuisines and spa treatments.
